docs.lead_paragraph: A Detroit-area teacher says she was fired from her post at a private Catholic all-girls high school after she and her lesbian partner announced they were expecting a child through non-traditional means.

headline.main: Lesbian Teacher Says Fired by Detroit Catholic School Over Pregnancy
headline.print_headline: Lesbian Teacher Says Fired by Detroit Catholic School Over Pregnancy

docs.snippet: A Detroit-area teacher says she was fired from her post at a private Catholic all-girls high school after she and her lesbian partner announced they were expecting a child through non-traditional means.

docs.lead_paragraph: A Pennsylvania woman has been sentenced to prison for helping to end her teen daughter's pregnancy by giving her pills purchased online.

headline.main: Mom Imprisoned for Giving Abortion Pills to Teen
headline.print_headline: Mom Imprisoned for Giving Abortion Pills to Teen

docs.snippet: A Pennsylvania woman has been sentenced to prison for helping to end her teen daughter's pregnancy by giving her pills purchased online.

docs.lead_paragraph: Wendy Davis has revealed her own deeply personal abortion story, writing in a memoir that goes on sale this week that she ended two pregnancies in the 1990s for medical reasons.

headline.main: Texas Candidate Reveals Personal Tale of Two Abortions
headline.print_headline: Texas Candidate Reveals Personal Tale of Two Abortions

docs.abstract: Revelation by Wendy Davis, Democratic candidate for governor of Texas, that she had two abortions for medical reasons in 1990s has rallied state's Democrats to her campaign; Democrats and Republicans differ on whether Davis's memoir Forgetting to be Afraid detailing her experiences will sway results of election.
docs.snippet: Wendy Davis has revealed her own deeply personal abortion story, writing in a memoir that goes on sale this week that she ended two pregnancies in the 1990s for medical reasons.

docs.lead_paragraph: Her priority is taking care of their baby; the work that her husband does happens to involve sex with other women.

headline.main: For Kayden Kross, the Family Business Happens to Be Porn
headline.print_headline: When the Family Business Happens to Be Porn

docs.abstract: Kayden Kross Modern Love column shares how she coped with dating, and later getting engaged to, a fellow porn star; says choosing the right partner is the key to any successful relationship.
docs.snippet: Her priority is taking care of their baby; the work that her husband does happens to involve sex with other women.

docs.lead_paragraph: The filmmaker Ira Sachs’s family includes his husband, Boris Torres, their twins, and the children’s mother, Kirsten Johnson.

headline.seo: The Filmmaker Ira Sachs: Home on Fifth Avenue

docs.abstract: Filmmaker Ira Sachs loves the lower Fifth Avenue two-bedroom apartment that he shares with husband Boris Torres and their two twins because the children's mother lives next door and the twins have a bedroom in each apartment.
docs.snippet: The filmmaker Ira Sachs’s family includes his husband, Boris Torres, their twins, and the children’s mother, Kirsten Johnson.

docs.lead_paragraph: World number one Novak Djokovic had no explanation for his flat performance in a stunning semi-final loss to Japan's Kei Nishikori at the U.S. Open on Saturday.

headline.main: 'I Just Wasn't Myself', Says Djokovic After Stunning Loss
headline.print_headline: 'I Just Wasn't Myself', Says Djokovic After Stunning Loss

docs.snippet: World number one Novak Djokovic had no explanation for his flat performance in a stunning semi-final loss to Japan's Kei Nishikori at the U.S. Open on Saturday.

docs.lead_paragraph: A Pennsylvania woman has been sentenced to up to 18 months in prison for obtaining so-called abortion pills online and providing them to her teenage daughter to end her pregnancy.

headline.main: Pennsylvania Mother Who Gave Daughter Abortion Pill Gets Prison
headline.print_headline: Pennsylvania Mother Who Gave Daughter Abortion Pill Gets Prison

docs.snippet: A Pennsylvania woman has been sentenced to up to 18 months in prison for obtaining so-called abortion pills online and providing them to her teenage daughter to end her pregnancy.

docs.lead_paragraph: Wendy Davis, the Democratic candidate for Texas governor who was catapulted to national fame last year for her 10-hour filibuster against abortion restrictions, revealed in her memoir she ended two pregnancies of her own, the San Antonio Express-News reported on Friday.

headline.main: Democratic Candidate for Texas Governor Reveals Abortions: Report
headline.print_headline: Democratic Candidate for Texas Governor Reveals Abortions: Report

docs.snippet: Wendy Davis, the Democratic candidate for Texas governor who was catapulted to national fame last year for her 10-hour filibuster against abortion restrictions, revealed in her memoir she ended two pregnancies of her own, the San Antonio Express-News...

docs.lead_paragraph: Texas Democrat Wendy Davis launched her longshot bid for governor by filibustering her state's tough new restrictions on abortion, and now she's entering the last two months of the race talking about undergoing the procedure herself.

headline.main: Memoir Puts Abortion Back in Texas Governor's Race
headline.print_headline: Memoir Puts Abortion Back in Texas Governor's Race

docs.snippet: Texas Democrat Wendy Davis launched her longshot bid for governor by filibustering her state's tough new restrictions on abortion, and now she's entering the last two months of the race talking about undergoing the procedure herself.

docs.lead_paragraph: Wendy Davis, the Democratic candidate for governor, reveals in a new campaign memoir that she terminated two pregnancies for medical reasons in the 1990s.

headline.main: Texas Candidate Says She Ended Pregnancies
headline.print_headline: Texas Candidate Says She Ended Pregnancies

docs.abstract: Wendy Davis, Democratic candidate for governor of Texas, reveals that she terminated two pregnancies for medical reasons in the 1990s, making disclosure for first time since her nearly 13-hour filibuster last year over a tough new Texas abortion law; revelation comes in her memoir Forgetting to be Afraid.
docs.snippet: Wendy Davis, the Democratic candidate for governor, reveals in a new campaign memoir that she terminated two pregnancies for medical reasons in the 1990s.
